page.title: 16Transport and Communications
page.content:
{Brightlingsea}has only the one road connecting it to the outside world. Depending upon ones needs this can be either a blessing or a curse. At one time the town was connected to {Wivenhoe}by way of a rail link but this has long since been axed.As a result the sole means of public transport is the bus. A half hourly service connects with{Colchester,}the routes circling the town in alternate directions each half hour.There is also an infrequent service to{Clacton.
The majority of commuters prefer to use private rather than public transportation, many vehicles being shared. The advent of the traffic from the port facility has placed quite a strain on the single access system.
